meanings.definition: To place or lay (one thing) over another
meanings.sent1: She will superpose the blue blanket on top of the red one.
meanings.sent2: Please superpose the papers neatly on the desk.
meanings.sent3: Trying to superpose the puzzle pieces without looking was a fun challenge.
meanings.sent4: His memories seemed to superpose, creating a vivid collage of the past.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes superpose to form a beautiful masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To combine or blend (two things) together
meanings.sent1: They superpose the flavors of chocolate and mint in the dessert.
meanings.sent2: The chef will superpose the ingredients to create a unique dish.
meanings.sent3: The colors of the rainbow seemed to superpose in the sky after the rain.
meanings.sent4: Her voice superposed with the melody, creating a harmonious song.
meanings.sent5: The scents of flowers and herbs superpose in the garden, creating a delightful aroma.

meanings.definition: To overlap or coincide in position
meanings.sent1: The two circles superpose perfectly, creating a Venn diagram.
meanings.sent2: The shadows of the trees superpose on the grass in the evening.
meanings.sent3: The schedules of the two friends superpose, allowing them to meet for lunch.
meanings.sent4: His dreams and reality seemed to superpose, blurring the lines between them.
meanings.sent5: The layers of paint superpose to form a textured surface on the canvas.
